name: whatever
posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: it is not important what is; it makes no difference what (is)

example.egtrans: 无论天气怎样我们都要去。

example.eg: Whatever happens, you know that I'll stand by you.
example.egtrans: 你知道无论发生什么，我都会支持你。

example.eg: Whatever else may be said of him, Mr Meese is not scared of a fight.
example.egtrans: 无论别人还说他什么，米斯先生并不害怕打上一架。

example.eg: Whatever the outcome of the war, there will be no winners.
example.egtrans: 无论战争的结果如何，谁都不会是胜利者。

example.eg: Whatever the reason, more people are emigrating to Australia today than at any time since the 1950s.
example.egtrans: 不论出于什么原因，如今移民澳大利亚的人比20世纪50年代以来的任何时候都要多。

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

example.eg: I eat whatever I want and I still don't seem to put on weight.
example.egtrans: 我想吃什么就吃什么，仍然不见体重有所增长。

example.eg: "What can we do tonight?" "It's up to you - whatever you want."
example.egtrans: “那我们今天晚上做什么呢？”“由你决定──你想做什么都可以。”

example.eg: Whatever I say I always seem to get it wrong.
example.egtrans: 无论我说什么，似乎总是说错。

example.eg: Don't, whatever you do, tell Patrick (= you certainly should not tell him).
example.egtrans: 无论做什么，千万别告诉帕特里克。

example.eg: Do whatever you want - it won't affect me.
example.egtrans: 你想做什么就做什么吧——不会影响到我的。

example.eg: "So, I'll bring red wine." "Sure, whatever (= bring that or anything else)."
example.egtrans: “那么我就带红酒来了。”“当然可以，带什么都行。”

example.eg: Apparently he "discovered himself" in India, whatever that means (= I do not know what that means).
example.egtrans: 显然他在印度“发现了自己”，不管那究竟意味着什么。

name: whatever
posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: used instead of the word "what" to add emphasis to a phrase, usually expressing surprise
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于代替 what，加以强调以表示惊讶）到底什么，究竟是什么

example.eg: Whatever is he doing with that rod?
example.egtrans: 他拿着那根竿子到底在做什么？

example.eg: Whatever's that yellow thing on your plate?
example.egtrans: 你盘子里那团黄色的东西到底是什么？

example.eg: Whatever did you say that for?
example.egtrans: 你说那种话到底是为什么？

example.eg: Whatever does she see in him - he's horrible!
example.egtrans: 她究竟看中了他什么——他真让人反感！

example.eg: Whatever made him buy that jacket?
example.egtrans: 他怎么买了那件夹克衫？

name: whatever
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于否定句后表强调）无论怎样

example.eg: There is no evidence whatever to show that this is in fact the case.
example.egtrans: 根本就没有任何证据表明这就是实际情况。

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is said to show no respect to someone who is asking you to agree with them or agree to do something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于有人强迫自己同意其观点或做某事的的时候）怎样都行，无所谓

example.eg: "Bryce, could you do what I ask you to once in a while?" "Whatever."
example.egtrans: “布赖斯，我要你做的事你能不能偶尔做一次？”“无所谓。”
